seriesJson.title: American adventure
seriesJson.description: This series studies the values and characteristics of notable figures from America's early years. A study of man in the New World: his values and characteristics, who he is, what he lives by. It is written by John M. Ehle and directed by John S. Clayton.

node.title: Free man
node.description: The story of Joseph Palmer, a 19th century American who refused to pay a fine for keeping facial hair and was imprisoned as a result. On principle, Palmer remained in prison until he was finally released more than a year later.

node.title: Orchid
node.description: This program dramatizes an episode in the life of a young George Washington Carver.

node.title: Zenger trial
node.description: The landmark trial of John Zenger is dramatized. The Zenger Trial helped to establish freedom of the press in the American colonies, affirming that truth is a defense against charges of libel.
